title: Telnet connexion
author: CHAVYZ
body_snippet:
Failed login telnet on the first time 

## Expected Behavior
telnet xx.xx.xx.xx 7777 > pass > ok 

## Current Behavior
PuTTYNG.exe xx.xx.xx.xx 7777 > good or false password > "Mot de pase incorrect !" ( bad password with spelling mistake "pase" = "passe" )
re type good password and then I am log in  
>help

## Possible Solution
Maybe a bad parameter in Putty terminal ?
Difference between French and English ?
port 7777  ( and no 23 ) ?
netping materiel
network?

## Steps to Repro...

iterations.description: Issue reports Telnet login failing on first attempt via PuTTYNG with a specific third-party device (Netping TPE), no reproduction on standard Telnet port, likely a device-specific or French locale prompt-matching issue that needs updated steps to reproduce on current build.

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet:
@CHAVYZ Are you using puttyng or mremote to initiate the connection? Does the problem also occur with the normal putty client?
Since it works fine for your cisco switch I think this could be a problem with the JDC "Nepting TPE". Have you tried to telnet from you windows command line?

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Issue reports Telnet login failing on first attempt via PuTTYNG with a specific third-party device (Netping TPE), no reproduction on standard Telnet port, likely a device-specific or French locale prompt-matching issue that needs updated steps to reproduce on current build.
Approach: Request user to retest on latest build with standard Telnet device; if reproducible, investigate PuTTY terminal emulation locale/prompt detection in ProtocolPutty or PuttyNG integration
